TopicTitle: Kadvent Kalender - 24 missions leading up to christmas

Articles.Content:
Day 26 - In retrospect developing and flying a shuttle to the Night Wind space station the day after Khristmas when everyone was still hung over from too much holiday cheer was a really bad idea. One might say it was doomed to failure. At first we tried to develop a SSTO but after testing many different designs the result was the same - an uncontrolled flight into the ocean shortly after leaving the runway.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

At this point the SSTO design was shelved and more traditional design was attempted. Getting to orbit was no problem for this design but in our haste we failed to do adequate testing on important things like could it get back from orbit.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

We then started up a skunk works program to develop a shuttle that could at least glide somewhat adequately. This one did not fly at all adequately. Looks like we need another test pilot.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

We made more extensive changes and this one flew - briefly.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The next test pilot wisely insisted that we install an abort sequence including some parachutes. This one flew but it took some effort to keep it up since it constantly wanted to point the nose down.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

OK, it's getting late so let's widen the rear landing gear and adjust the position of the engines so that it hopefully is more forgiving to fly. While were at it let's just send it up and hope for the best. It was a success although the landing was not as planned.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Hi All

December 26th, Full stock, KSP 0.90.

Well, while Jeb, Bill and Bob were trying to go back home from Eeloo, the Kerbal engineer staff made a cool MK3 SSTO

Here is the album !

Hi Again

December 28th, 29th, Full stock, KSP 0.90.

And now, the BIG SSTO MK-3 plane flight !

20 Kerbals, 21 Tons of Fuel/Monoprop payload for KSS in the bay...

Really slow to dock, the number of kerbals parts in space is high now ^^

Edited December 29, 2014 by astrobond

Day 27 - Although the PHB said there was no budget left to test the MK3 Shuttle we figured it would be perfect for the South Pole contract. At first everything seemed to be going well but there obviously were still some kinks to work out. In the end we did complete the contract but we also left Addin stranded at the South Pole.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

- - - Updated - - -

Day 29 - The resupply mission ran into a Kraken and part of the port wing was torn off. We're still trying to decide whether to send a rescue shuttle or to fly this one back as is.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Hey all, hope everybody had a pleasant Christmas. Since nobody commented on the exploding Christmas Tree of December 24th, I'm assuming I'm good. I've been home for a day or two now, so I figured I'd go ahead and start in on the Apres-Noel part of the challenge:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I'm still in KSP 0.25 pending an update to the LoadOnDemand mod, so I don't yet have access to the new Mk3 parts. As a cop-out though, I made the Ostrich out of as many Mk2 parts as I could manage, so hopefully I'm still all cool and froody.

EDIT: And this morning I'm reading that December 29th is the last of the challenges, so that means I've finished the whole thing. Thanks for the challenges; I know I had fun doing them, even if I didn't have the time I needed...

Edited December 31, 2014 by capi3101

Okay, better late tan never I guess. Too much work and too little time to play
